head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Council Endorsement

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Council Endorsement

body.head.byline: By SEWELL CHAN; Compiled by John Sullivan

abstract.p: Rep Yvette D Clarke, Brooklyn Democrat who resigned from City Council after being elected to Congress in November 2006, endorses Mathieu Eugene to succeed her on Council (S)

block.p: Representative Yvette D. Clarke, a Brooklyn Democrat who resigned from the City Council after she was elected to Congress in November, endorsed Mathieu Eugene yesterday to succeed her on the Council. Mr. Eugene, a Haitian immigrant who runs a youth recreation center in Flatbush, faces 12 other candidates in a special election on Feb. 20. At a news conference, Ms. Clarke's mother, Una S. T. Clarke, an influential former councilwoman, and the Haitian-American Association for Progressive Action, a political group, also endorsed Mr. Eugene. His main rivals for the seat include Jesse E. Hamilton III, a Democratic district leader with support from several unions; Jennifer N. James, a political activist who raised money for Ms. Clarke's Congressional race; and Wellington Sharpe, who runs a child care company.

James, a political activist who raised money for Ms. Clarke’s Congressional race; and Wellington Sharpe, who runs a child care company.
